newsitem.title: ANGOLA: Angola detains 29 S.Africans in visa probe.
newsitem.headline: Angola detains 29 S.Africans in visa probe.

text.p: Angolan immigration officials have detained 29 South Africans during a drive against illegal immigrants exploiting alluvial diamond deposits, South Africa's ambassador to Luanda said on Saturday.
"They were caught in the Lunda Norte province where they are mining and their documents are being processed by the police and immigration authorities," Roger Ballard-Tremer told reporters.
He said the South Africans were staff of the British-South African company Branch Energy Ltd which has partnerships with several Angolan companies.
"The company is negotiating to correct the situation," the ambassador said.
Earlier this month Angola deported 18 South Africans whose work papers it said were not in order.
